hours_text:
###  Reserve Your Time with a Ticket

Tickets can sell out fast and may not be available at the door. Buy your tickets in advance to guarantee entrance at your preferred time.

[ Get Tickets ](https://tnew.gardnermuseum.org/events) [ Become a Member ](/join-give/membership)

## Admission & More

Your ticket to the Museum includes admission to all special exhibitions. Some [events](/calendar) require a separate ticket. See below for free and discounted admission offers. 

Learn about our [inclusive Museum experiences](/visit#:~:text=Information%20for). 

[FAQs](/visit#:~:text=Guidelines%20%26%20Policies)

Adult| $22  
---|---  
Children (17 and under)| Free  
Senior (65 and up)| $20  
Student (with current ID)| $15  
Members| Free  
  
  * ## 

##  Free for Members and Friends of Fenway Court Patrons 

Enjoy free admission, invitations to exclusive events, and much more. 

**Members**  
Advance tickets are encouraged—[log in](https://tnew.gardnermuseum.org/account/login) using your email address on file to access member tickets. Members can present their cards at time of visit to enjoy same-day access.  
Review [Membership levels and benefits here](/join-give/membership).  
Currently a Member? [Click here.](/existing-members)   
  
**Friends of Fenway Court Patrons**  
Friends of Fenway Court Patrons can reserve tickets for themselves or their guests by emailing [patrons@isgm.org](mailto:patrons@isgm.org) or by calling the Patron Line at [617 264 6045](tel:6172646045). Please ...

collections_text:
Escape the Ordinary at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum 

In 1903, Isabella Stewart Gardner opened her museum “for the education and enjoyment of the public forever.” 

Today's Hours: 10am – 5pm  All hours 

Monday:
     11:00am–5:00pm 

Tuesday:
     Closed 

Wednesday:
     11:00am–5:00pm 

Thursday:
     11:00am–9:00pm 

Friday:
     11:00am–5:00pm 

Saturday:
     10:00am–5:00pm 

Sunday:
     10:00am–5:00pm 

[Plan Your Visit](/visit) [Get Tickets](https://tnew.gardnermuseum.org/events)

###  Exhibitions

Fall Exhibitions: October 23, 2025–January 19, 2026  
Winter/Spring 2026 Exhibitions: February 19–May 10, 2026

[ Exhibitions ](/exhibitions)

Public Program 

###  [ What Rembrandt Saw: The History of Stealing, Conserving, and Protecting Art in Boston ](https://www.gardnermuseum.org/calendar/what-rembrandt-saw-1.22.26)

January 22, 2026

Join the Gardner’s Director of Security and Director of Conservation as they discuss their decades of combined experience caring for the Gardner’s collection, as well as why Rembrandt’s artworks have been repeatedly targeted by criminals, both locally and globally. 

Music 

###  [ Thursday Night Music ](https://tnew.gardnermuseum.org/37024/37030)

February 26, 2026

The Gardner’s new series, Thursday Night Music, launches with a bang. Ensemble Signal performs Steve Reich’s seminal minimalist work, _Music for 18 Musicians_ —one of David Bowie's favorite albumns of all time. Get your tickets and celebrate the 50th anniversary of this...
